posts.html:
@Ferlord, that "odd" body ensures that opponents using Blue's nemesis color will have to zap it at least twice. (Well, four times if we're being literal). They have to spend their own turn taking care of this bastard of a card instead of clearing your field on your turn.

Anyway, what an incredible card. One of the biggest wrenches you can throw in any enemy's plans, especially in the blue mirror match. With Teferi, you save your mana to counter their spells like normal. But wait! Instead of untapping and going on your way like normal, just throw your creature of choice on their turn so it's ready to beat face and/or activate its ability on yours.

All attached to one of Ma... (see all)

posts.post_content:
Suspend? Cascaded spells? Ripple? Isochron scepter spell?  
  
Teferi says NO to your shenanigans. None of those will resolve.  
  
The classic guy to end of turn someone with. And the best? Tutorable with mystical teachings. This guy is not the best creature ever, but he's the ultimate silver bullet to many decks. He destroys control decks like it's nobody's business.

posts.post_content: Teferi is an amazing character. Rivaled only by Urza and Tezzeret (Huge fan of blue walkers). And I just wanted to be the first to say that with Teferi on your side, even miracles can't save your opponents. 5/5 for being one of the Vorthos and Johnny cards of all time. I mean this guy controls control better than any other card ever. The only blue card I might love more is [Mind Over Matter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mind Over Matter). You rock Teferi, you are the mythic standard.

just use it lik my [Animar, Soul of Elements](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Animar, Soul of Elements)EDH deck does by using [Seedborn Muse](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Seedborn Muse), [Jin-Gitaxias, Core Augur](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Jin-Gitaxias, Core Augur), [Animar, Soul of Elements](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Animar, Soul of Elements) and of course [Teferi, Mage of Zhalfir](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Teferi, Mage of Zhalfir ) , my advice for a card draw engine is something whitch lets you draw cards by activated ability ( whitout "tap" in its cost)

Posted By: Crackmore (3/17/2012 8:09:10 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
This is ironically the FTV: Legends card that makes me saddest. Not mad at all- just sad.   
  
They showed THE best card in the set first, and literally ever since the 2nd-15th cards, I got less, and less, and less excited. Teferi set the bar so high, and I THOUGHT he was going to be the 'average' bar of the set's quality. Which would have been FREAKIN SWEET and guaranteed us a set truly worthy of the name "From the Vault: Legends"  
  
Even if From the Vault: Relics, From the Vault: Dragons, and From the Vault: Exiled's tradition is redeemed by From the Vault: Realms, of the Five Vaulted Sets so far, "Legends" had by far the coolest name and the most potential. And they dropped the ball. And part of it was because they included no cards that were particularly more 'oh WOW-inspiring' than Teferi, Mage of Zhalfir.  
  
He's a great card, and a great guy, and *he* earned his spot. But he deserved to have better companions to share the Vault with.
posts.html:

Teferi set the bar so high, and I THOUGHT he was going to be the 'average' bar of the set's quality. Which would have been FREAKIN SWEET and guaranteed us a set truly worthy of the name "From the Vault: Legends"

Even if From the Vault: Relics, From the Vault: Dragons, and From the Vault: Exiled's tradition is redeemed by From the Vault: Realms, of the Five Vaulted Sets so far, "Legends" had by far the coolest name and the most potential. And they dropped the ball. And part of it was because they included no cards that were particularly more 'oh WOW-inspiring' than Teferi, Mage of Zhalfir.

He's a great card, and a great guy, and he earned his spot. But he deserved to have better companions to share the Vault with.
